endpoints_implemented: GET /reports - List all reports with filtering (device_id, type, status, limit, offset)
POST /reports/generate - Generate a new report (security, traffic, bandwidth, firewall, vpn, dns, device, system)
GET /reports/:id - Get report details with download URL
DELETE /reports/:id - Delete a report and associated R2 file
GET /logs - List logs with filtering (device_id, level, category, search, date range, limit, offset)
POST /logs/export - Export logs to CSV or JSON format (stored in R2 REPORTS bucket)
GET /onboarding/routers - List 4 router options (ASUS RT-AX92U, GL.iNet Flint 2, Linksys WRT3200ACM, GL.iNet Flint 3)
POST /onboarding/order - Submit router order with full configuration
GET /onboarding/status - Get onboarding status and progress

GET /dashboards/:id - Get dashboard with widgets (network-overview, security-events, dns-analytics, wifi-performance, wan-health, vpn-metrics, system-resources, traffic-analysis, firewall-rules, qos-metrics)
notes: Reports API uses D1 for metadata and R2 REPORTS bucket for file storage
Report formats: PDF, CSV, JSON with status tracking (pending, generating, completed, failed)
Logs API includes comprehensive filtering with JOIN to devices table for owner validation
Log export generates files on-demand and stores in R2 with download URLs
Onboarding API already existed with complete implementation including 4 router options from MANIFEST.md
Onboarding includes full shipping address, WiFi config, WAN config, security presets
Dashboards provide 10+ categories with detailed widget configurations
Each dashboard includes multiple widgets (line-chart, bar-chart, pie-chart, gauge, counter, table, heatmap, map)
All endpoints follow Clerk JWT authentication pattern via security: [{ bearerAuth: [] }]
Mock data provided for dashboards - production would fetch real-time metrics
Database migrations will be needed for reports, logs, and onboarding_orders tables
